page.content: feed the animals. Pasture land is used for grazing the sheep and the cows. In other fields the grass is encouraged to grow by using high nitrogen fertilizer and also farmyard manure in order to get grass for silage. This crop is cut in the early summer and allowed to wilt overnight in the field. It is then gathered by a forage harvester which cuts it into 2.5 cm pieces and blows it into a trailer. It is then taken to a shed where the grass is emptied into a large pile surrounded by a large plastic sheet. A tractor runs up and down the pile trying to squeeze as much air as possible out of the grass. The pile is enclosed inside the plastic sheeting and it ferments to eventually become an edible winter feed. In some fields the grass is allowed
